items.title: Chinese buyers are getting Nvidia Blackwell chips despite U.S. export controls
items.summary:
- Chinese buyers are acquiring Nvidia’s Blackwell chips through third-party traders in regions like Malaysia, Taiwan, and Vietnam.
- Former President Biden introduced new export restrictions on AI chips just before leaving office, affecting China.
- Nvidia previously stated that these restrictions would impede global innovation and did not respond to requests for comment.

items.title: Conan O’Brien comments on AI during his opening monologue at the Oscars
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Conan O’Brien hosted the 2025 Oscars and discussed the role of AI in Hollywood during his opening monologue.
- He stated, "We did not use AI to make this show," referencing AI's involvement in the Oscar-winning film "The Brutalist."
- The film has faced controversy for using AI technology in editing, including AI voice generation to enhance dialogue authenticity.
- The debate around AI's role in films intensified after "The Brutalist," with calls for stricter guidelines on AI use in film submissions by the Motion Picture Academy.

items.title: T-Mobile and Perplexity announce new ‘AI phone’ priced at under $1K
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- T-Mobile announces an AI Phone developed in collaboration with Perplexity, Picsart, and others.
- The device will be unveiled in the second half of 2025 and sold for under $1,000 starting in 2026.
- T-Mobile aims to become an AI-focused company, leveraging generative AI technologies for improved user experience.
- Magenta AI, a new AI assistant app, will be available for T-Mobile customers on existing devices.
- The partnership between Perplexity and Deutsche Telekom began in April 2024, focusing on proactive AI applications.

items.title: Stability AI optimized its audio generation model to run on Arm chips
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- AI startup Stability AI has partnered with Arm to optimize its AI audio model, Stable Audio Open, for mobile devices.
- The model can generate audio based on text descriptions and is designed to work offline, differing from many cloud-dependent AI audio apps.
- Stable Audio Open's training set consists entirely of royalty-free audio to avoid copyright issues.
- The optimized model can generate an 11-second audio sample in about 8 seconds on an Armv9 CPU, achieving 30x faster generation.
- The model is not yet available for public download, but Stability plans to integrate it into consumer apps in the future.
- Stability AI has seen changes in leadership and aims to recover from previous financial struggles.

items.title: As Skype shuts down, its legacy is end-to-end encryption for the masses
items.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary:
- Microsoft announced it will shut down Skype on May 5, 2025, reducing its user base from a peak of 300 million to 36 million in 2023.
- Skype was launched in 2003, being the first to offer end-to-end encryption for calls and messages, significantly influencing privacy in communication apps.
- Despite its downfall, Skype's legacy continues with the adoption of end-to-end encryption technologies by popular apps like iMessage, WhatsApp, and Signal.

items.title: HackerPulse wants to help enterprises spot engineering bottlenecks
items.author: Gleb Braverman
items.summary:
- HackerPulse has developed a platform for enterprises to identify productivity bottlenecks in their engineering teams.
- The platform integrates with developer tools like GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket to provide insights into team activities.
- HackerPulse was launched in July 2024 and has already gained 20,000 users.
- The startup recently raised $1.5 million in a seed round to expand operations and refine its product offerings.
- Focused on telecommunication, manufacturing, and logistics sectors, HackerPulse aims to improve visibility and efficiency among engineering teams.

items.title: Jolla founders take the wraps off an AI assistant to power up their push for privacy-friendly GenAI
items.summary:
- Jolla has unveiled an AI assistant designed as a privacy-centric alternative to data-mining cloud services.
- The AI will integrate with apps like email and social media, providing users with a personalized conversational tool for managing their digital tasks.
- An AI agent marketplace is planned to launch next month, allowing users to expand the assistant's capabilities.
- The software, branded as Mindy, will operate via a subscription service hosted on a private cloud by Venho.ai, with a demo shown at Mobile World Congress in Barcelona.
- Initial pricing for the AI assistant is $10 per month for early adopters, later rising to $20.
- Users can self-host the assistant on Jolla's Mind 2 device, enabling private data management without reliance on third-party services.

items.title: Cloudsmith raises $23M to improve software supply chain security
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Cloudsmith, a Northern Irish startup, raised $23 million in a Series B funding round led by TCV to improve software supply chain security.
- The company offers a cloud-native artifact management platform aimed at providing alternatives to legacy platforms like JFrog and Sonatype.
- Founded in Belfast in 2016, Cloudsmith previously raised $26 million in Series A funding and focuses on ensuring the reliability and security of software packages through scanning and curation.

items.title: Opera unveils an AI agent that runs natively within the browser
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- Opera has launched a new AI agent named Browser Operator that assists users on various websites.
- Demonstrated tasks include finding socks from Walmart, securing football tickets, and booking travel on Booking.com.
- The feature will be available soon through Opera's Feature Drop program.
- Uncertainty remains if the agent can perform broader tasks across multiple websites.
- The Browser Operator is said to be more secure as it operates natively on devices rather than through cloud services.
- The market for AI agents in browsers is competitive, with similar offerings from OpenAI and upcoming browsers like Dia and Comet.

items.title: Uber is piloting accounts for teenagers in India
items.author: Jagmeet Singh
items.summary:
- Uber has launched a pilot of its 'Uber for Teens' service in India, available in Bengaluru, Delhi NCR, and Mumbai.
- The service allows parents to set up accounts for teenagers aged 13-17, enabling them to request rides with their own devices.
- Features include live trip tracking, opt-in audio recording, and monthly trip limits for guardians.
- Uber will conduct additional background checks on drivers for this service.
- 'Uber for Teens' has been operational in around 50 countries and aims to compete with local services like Ola and Rapido.

items.title: Google’s Gemini now lets you ask questions using videos and what’s on your screen
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- Google introduces a new "Screenshare" feature for its AI assistant, Gemini, allowing users to share their screen and ask questions.
- Users demonstrated the feature by asking Gemini about clothing choices while shopping for jeans.
- Video search capabilities let users ask questions about videos in real time while filming.
- These updates will be available for Gemini Advanced users on the Google One AI Premium plan later this month.

items.title: Signal is the number-one downloaded app in the Netherlands. But why?
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Signal is the most downloaded free app in the Netherlands on both iOS and Android as of February 2025.
- The surge in popularity is attributed to growing awareness of privacy and distrust of big tech, following various policy changes and geopolitical events.
- In an interview, Signal's president, Meredith Whittaker, reported a 25-fold increase in new registrations in the Netherlands.
- Total downloads of Signal in the country rose from 22,000 in December to approximately 233,000 by February, a 958% increase.
- The rise of Signal is seen against a backdrop of increased public debate surrounding reliance on dominant tech companies and digital privacy issues in the Netherlands.

items.title: Apple might not release a truly ‘modernized’ Siri until 2027
items.summary:
[Apple is struggling to rebuild Siri for the age of generative AI.]
[The modernized version of Siri might not be released until iOS 20 in 2027.]
[An updated version of Siri is expected to debut in May, incorporating Apple Intelligence features.]

items.title: Flora is building an AI-powered ‘infinite canvas’ for creative professionals
items.author: Anthony Ha
items.summary:
- Flora is a new startup founded by Weber Wong, aimed at providing creative professionals with better AI tools.
- The startup's manifesto critiques existing AI creative tools and promises to offer enhanced creative control.
- Unlike traditional generative AI models, Flora emphasizes a visual interface called an 'infinite canvas' for collaborative creative work.
- The initial focus is on visual design agencies, with feedback being received from renowned agency Pentagram.
- Flora integrates with existing AI models but is predominantly centered on improving the user experience.
- The product launched its alpha version in August, featuring a live art project that interacts with users' creativity in real time.
- The startup is backed by A16Z Games; its free tier allows limited projects, with a professional plan costing $16 per month.

items.title: Trump calls for creation of a ‘crypto strategic reserve’
items.author: Anthony Ha
items.summary:
- President Trump supports the creation of a federal reserve for cryptocurrency, mentioning XRP, Solana, and Cardano.
- His January executive order initiated a working group to explore creating a national digital asset stockpile.
- Following his recent social media post, the prices of XRP, SOL, and ADA surged by over 20%.

items.title: Aviron’s $2,499 gamified treadmill will keep you on your toes
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Aviron’s new $2,499 Victory Treadmill integrates gaming to make workouts more engaging.
- The treadmill features a 22-inch touchscreen for games, streaming services, and virtual routes.
- Unlike other fitness brands, Aviron aims to differentiate through gamification rather than instructor-led classes.

items.title: Last chance! Last 24 hours to save up to $325 on TechCrunch Sessions: AI
items.summary:
- Register for [TechCrunch Sessions: AI](https://techcrunch.com/events/tc-sessions-ai/?utm_source=tc&utm_medium=post&utm_campaign=tcsessionsai&utm_content=post_seb1day_03022025&promo=post_seb1day_03022025&display=) by 11:59 p.m. PT tonight to save up to $325 on passes.
- The event will feature insights from AI pioneers, hands-on demos, and networking opportunities on June 5, 2025, at UC Berkeley.
- Key speakers include Jae Lee (CEO of Twelve Labs), Oliver Cameron (CEO of Odyssey), and others, discussing the future of AI and investment expectations from founders.

items.title: The TechCrunch AI glossary
items.author: Natasha Lomas, Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- The TechCrunch AI glossary provides definitions for important AI terms used in the industry.
- It aims to help readers understand complex AI jargon and evolving technologies.
- The glossary will be regularly updated to reflect new entries and methods in artificial intelligence as well as safety risks.

items.title: Mark Cuban offers to fund government tech unit that was cut in the middle of the night
items.author: Connie Loizos
items.summary:
- Mark Cuban made an offer to support recently laid-off employees from the government’s 18F technology unit on Bluesky.
- Approximately 70 employees were laid off due to government budget cuts and restructuring.
- Cuban suggested that workers form a consulting company, claiming their expertise would be needed as contractors for agencies.
- This event follows a directive from the Trump administration to cut federal spending and workforce.
- Cuban’s proposal raises questions about the potential of displaced government workers to start their own civic tech ventures.

items.title: Researchers explore how to build shapeshifting, T-1000-style robots
items.author: Matthew Devlin, Otger Campàs
items.summary:
- Researchers have developed robots that can change shape and shift between solid and fluid-like states.
- Led by Matthew Devlin from UC Santa Barbara, findings were published in Science.
- Inspired by embryonic tissues, the robots use motorized gears, magnets, and photodetectors for movement and communication.
- Current robots are over 5 cm in diameter, with aims to reduce size to 1-2 cm or smaller.

items.title: OpenAI launches GPT-4.5, its largest model to date
items.author: Cody Corrall
items.summary:
- OpenAI launched GPT-4.5, the AI model code-named Orion, which is the largest to date.
- The rollout of GPT-4.5 was staggered due to OpenAI being "out of GPUs."
- Subscribers to the ChatGPT Pro plan can access GPT-4.5 in a research preview, with others to follow next week.
- Microsoft is shutting down Skype on May 5, prompting users to migrate data to Microsoft Teams.
- Anthropic benchmarked its Claude 3.7 Sonnet AI model using Pokémon Red, successfully winning gym badges.
- Amazon announced a new Alexa experience, Alexa+, costing $19.99 a month, free for Prime members.

items.title: DeepSeek claims ‘theoretical’ profit margins of 545%
items.author: Anthony Ha
items.summary:
- Chinese AI startup DeepSeek claims its AI models can achieve a theoretical profit margin of 545%.
- The margin is based on speculative income and calculated from potential daily revenue of $562,027 versus GPU leasing costs of $87,072.
- Actual revenue is lower due to discounts and free services; usage estimates may not reflect true profitability.
- DeepSeek's technology gained attention for its potential in AI cost debates and briefly topped the App Store rankings before falling in position.

items.title: Ben Horowitz donates Cybertruck fleet to the Las Vegas police
items.author: Sean O’Kane
items.summary:
- Ben Horowitz donates a fleet of Tesla Cybertrucks to the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police.
- The donation follows over $7 million in previous gifts to the department, primarily for technology purchases.
- Las Vegas Sheriff Kevin McMahill announced the donation on February 25, indicating 10 Cybertrucks were given, though reports suggest there were 11.
- The trucks are seen as a safety measure for police and a recruitment tool.
- Unlike previous donations, this one was not made through the police foundation, raising questions about funding transparency.

items.title: How to get rid of the new Apple Mail redesign
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- The Apple Mail app underwent a redesign in iOS 18, now organizing emails into categories.
- Users are reporting issues with the visual appeal and navigation of the new interface, with complaints of it being unreliable and cluttered.
- Instructions are provided to revert to 'List View' and to toggle off contact photos to reduce clutter in the inbox.

items.title: 'Uber for guns' app Protector lets you hire armed body guards like you would an Uber — but does anyone need this?
items.summary:
- The Protector app allows users to hire armed bodyguards, similar to hailing a ride via Uber.
- Launched on February 17, 2025, in Los Angeles and New York City, it offers security services starting at $1,000 for a minimum of five hours.
- The app has generated significant buzz, with approximately 97,000 downloads in its first week, stemming largely from strategic marketing on social media.
- Target customers remain unclear, especially in light of the high cost for what some may view as an extravagant service.
- Competitor BlackWolf also offers similar services, and Protector plans to launch another app, Patrol, to crowdsource neighborhood security.
- Concerns arise regarding the suitability and safety implications of hiring private armed guards amidst broader societal issues regarding law enforcement and public safety.

items.title: 2 days left to save up to $325 on TechCrunch Sessions: AI tickets
items.summary:
- Only 2 days remain to save up to $325 on TechCrunch Sessions: AI tickets.
- Special offer ends on March 2 at 11:59 p.m. PT.
- The event will take place on June 5 in Zellerbach Hall at UC Berkeley, focusing on the AI industry and startup ecosystem.
- Attendees can gain insights from AI leaders, participate in breakout sessions, and enjoy product demos.

items.title: OpenAI’s startup empire: The companies backed by its venture fund
items.author: Marina Temkin
items.summary:
- OpenAI Startup Fund has raised $175 million for its main fund and an additional $114 million through five special purpose vehicles since its founding in 2021.
- The fund is backed by external investors, including Microsoft, and has invested in over a dozen startups.
- Notable investments include:
  - **1X**: $23.5 million raised in early 2023 for a humanoid robot startup.
  - **Ambience Healthcare**: $70 million Series B raised in February 2024.
  - **Anysphere**: $8 million seed round led by OpenAI in October 2023.
  - **Chai Discovery**: $30 million seed round in September 2024.
  - **Descript**: $50 million Series C.
  - **Figure AI**: $675 million Series B, valuing the company at $2.6 billion.
  - **Harvey AI**: $21 million Series A in April 2023, valued at $3 billion by Series D.
  - **Heeyo**: $3.5 million raised in August 2024.
  - **Unify**: $19 million secured for a sales tech startup.

items.title: What is Mistral AI? Everything to know about the OpenAI competitor
items.summary:
- Mistral AI is a French company known for its AI assistant, Le Chat, and several foundational models.
- Recently launched Le Chat on mobile, achieving 1 million downloads in two weeks.
- Mistral AI has raised around €1 billion since its inception in 2023, with a current valuation of approximately $6 billion.
- CEO Arthur Mensch and other founders have backgrounds from major U.S. tech companies like Google and Meta.
- Mistral AI differentiates its models as open-source and premiere models with commercial restrictions.
- The company signed several strategic partnerships, including with Microsoft and Agence France-Presse.

items.title: General Catalyst is reportedly weighing a potential IPO
items.author: Connie Loizos
items.summary:
- General Catalyst is contemplating an IPO, according to a report by Axios.
- The firm has evolved significantly since its founding 25 years ago in Cambridge, Massachusetts, starting with $73 million in commitments.
- With over $30 billion in assets today, GC has made substantial investments, including stakes in Airbnb and Stripe.
- The potential IPO raises the question of whether it could be the first venture firm to go public, which may influence other firms like Andreessen Horowitz.

items.title: Sergey Brin says RTO is key to Google winning the AGI race
items.summary:
- Sergey Brin urged Google employees to return to the office every weekday to enhance productivity in the AGI race.
- He suggested that working 60 hours a week is optimal for productivity.
- Brin's memo, although not official policy, reflects pressure on tech firms to compete in AI,
- It indicates Brin's belief in Google's potential to create superintelligent AI.
- He has returned to Google recently to help the company regain its edge in artificial intelligence following the unexpected rise of OpenAI's ChatGPT in 2022.

items.title: SymbyAI raises $2.1M seed to make science research easier
items.author: Ashia Livaudais, Michael House
items.summary:
- SymbyAI, a SaaS platform aimed at streamlining scientific research, raised $2.1 million in seed funding from investors including Drive Capital and CharacterVC.
- The platform, launched last year, offers organized workspaces for researchers to access various resources and track progress, employing AI features for peer review.
- The founder, Ashia Livaudais, started the company to address inefficient scientific research processes, emphasizing IP protection with their proprietary AI solution.
- The new funding will support company growth and initial partnerships, following connections made through the gBeta program.

items.title: Startup co-founded by longevity guru Peter Attia emerges from stealth
items.author: Charles Rollet
items.summary:
- Biograph, a new preventive health clinic co-founded by Dr. Peter Attia, has emerged from stealth in Silicon Valley.
- The clinic focuses on disease prevention through regular testing, offering membership options costing $7,500 to $15,000 per year.
- Biograph plans to open a New York City location and expand globally, having already operated since 2020, discovering urgent health insights for over 15% of its members.

items.title: OpenAI plans to bring Sora’s video generator to ChatGPT
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- OpenAI plans to integrate its AI video generator Sora into ChatGPT.
- Sora currently exists as a standalone web app allowing up to twenty-second video clips.
- The integration aims to simplify access for users and potentially increase subscription upgrades for ChatGPT.
- A new image generator powered by Sora is also in development.
- OpenAI is exploring options for a standalone mobile app for Sora.

items.title: OpenAI plans to integrate Sora’s video generator into ChatGPT
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- OpenAI intends to integrate its AI video generation tool, [Sora](https://techcrunch.com/2024/12/09/openais-sora-is-launching-today-heres-highlights-from-the-first-review/), into ChatGPT.
- Currently, Sora is available via a dedicated web app that generates up to 20-second video clips.
- OpenAI aims to broaden Sora's appeal and increase accessibility within ChatGPT, though no timeline is given.
- Sora may also expand to creating images, leveraging Sora’s capabilities to enhance photo realism.

items.title: DeepSeek: Everything you need to know about the AI chatbot app
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- DeepSeek's chatbot app reached the top of the Apple and Google Play Store charts, drawing significant attention.
- Founded by Liang Wenfeng, DeepSeek is backed by High-Flyer Capital Management, specializing in AI tools for trading.
- DeepSeek unveiled its first models in November 2023, with the next-gen DeepSeek-V2 launching in spring 2024, significantly impacting the AI market.
- China’s internet regulations impose limitations on DeepSeek’s responses about sensitive topics like Tiananmen Square.
- DeepSeek is available on Microsoft’s Azure AI Foundry service and has led to substantial changes in AI spending by competitors.
- The company is facing bans from various countries over data security concerns.

items.title: Researchers uncover unknown Android flaws used to hack into a student’s phone
items.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary:
- Amnesty International reported that Google fixed unknown Android flaws exploited by Cellebrite.
- The vulnerabilities could affect over a billion Android devices due to being rooted in the Linux USB kernel.
- The discovery followed a hack affecting a student activist's phone in Serbia and involved multiple zero-day vulnerabilities.

items.title: Google Sheets gets a Gemini-powered upgrade to analyze data faster and create visuals
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Google Sheets receives a Gemini-powered update for faster data analysis and visualizations.
- Users can generate insights like correlations, trends, and outliers using Gemini's capabilities.
- Advanced visualizations, such as heatmaps, can be inserted as static images in spreadsheets.
- The update is now available to all Workspace business users as of February 28, 2025.
- To use, click the Gemini icon and input requests like predicting net income or creating heatmaps.
- Gemini runs Python code for complex requests and uses formulas for simpler tasks.
- Data should be well-structured with clear headers and no missing values for accurate analysis.

items.title: Bluesky-based Instagram alternative Flashes launches publicly
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Flashes, a new photo-sharing app, launched this week on the App Store, gaining nearly 30,000 downloads in 24 hours.
- Developed by Sebastian Vogelsang, Flashes operates on the Bluesky protocol, allowing compatibility with Bluesky users.
- Features include customizable feeds, Portfolio Mode for curating profiles, and photo editing filters, aimed at photographers and content creators.

items.title: Good hype for fusion, bad buzz for YC
items.author: Anna Heim
items.summary:
- Startups saw both positive and negative responses, impacting funding rounds.
- Proxima Fusion's design for a reliable fusion power plant received praise in a peer-reviewed journal, adding credibility.
- Y Combinator faced backlash after deleting posts about Optifye.ai, which were criticized as 'sweatshops-as-a-service.'
- Inception introduced a diffusion-based large language model aiming to compete with existing LLMs.
- Quantum Machines raised $170 million in one of the largest funding rounds for quantum computing.
- Several startups raised significant amounts, including Shop Circle ($60 million Series B) and Nomagic ($44 million Series B).

items.title: A comprehensive list of 2024 and 2025 tech layoffs
items.summary:
- Over 150,000 job cuts across 542 tech companies in 2024 due to ongoing layoffs.
- Major companies like [Tesla](https://techcrunch.com/2024/04/15/tesla-layoffs-workers-sales-cybertruck-cuts/), [Amazon](https://techcrunch.com/2024/01/10/amazon-prime-video-and-mgm-studios-laid-off-hundreds-of-employees/), [Google](https://techcrunch.com/2024/01/10/google-cuts-hundreds-of-jobs-in-its-voice-assistance-hardware-teams-as-fitbit-founders-leave/), [TikTok](https://techcrunch.com/2024/01/23/tiktok-lays-off-60-employees/), [Snap](https://techcrunch.com/2024/02/05/snapchats-parent-lays-off-10-of-workforce-in-order-to-reduce-hierarchy-says-company/), and [Microsoft](https://techcrunch.com/2024/01/25/microsoft-lays-off-1900-employees-in-activision-blizzard-and-xbox-divisions/) have seen sizable layoffs.
- The layoffs are part of a larger trend affecting the tech industry, with trends being monitored into 2025 for further analysis.

items.title: Alkami is buying fintech Mantl for $400 million
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- Alkami Technology is acquiring fintech Mantl for $400 million.
- Mantl, founded in 2016, develops software to streamline digital account openings at community banks and credit unions.
- The deal is expected to close by the end of March 2025.
- Mantl’s technology aims to enhance competition among banks and improve customer options in digital banking.
- The company's last funding round valued it at $345 million post-money, raising over $96 million in total to date.

items.title: Tesla applies for ride-hail permit in California — but there’s a catch
items.summary:
- Tesla applied for a transportation service permit with the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) on November 2024.
- The permit, known as a TCP permit, is necessary for Tesla to operate a robotaxi service in California and is different from the permits held by Uber and Lyft.
- CEO Elon Musk announced plans for a paid ride-hailing robotaxi service in Austin to launch in June 2025, utilizing Tesla-owned vehicles and new Full Self-Driving software.
- Tesla gears towards driverless services despite moving operations to more regulatory-friendly locations like Texas.

items.title: Mozilla responds to backlash over new terms, saying it’s not using people’s data for AI
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Mozilla introduced new **Terms of Use** for Firefox, prompting user backlash due to unclear language about data usage.
- The company clarified that the terms are not a change in data practices but aim to formalize user agreements.
- Critics, including Brave CEO Brendan Eich, expressed concerns over possible data monetization related to AI.
- Mozilla reassured users that their data will not be shared with AI companies and remains de-identified when shared with advertisers.
- The new terms and updates aim to enhance transparency but have led to confusion and possible user migration to other browsers.

items.title: The biggest data breaches of 2025 — so far
items.summary:
- Several data breaches in early 2025 have affected the personal information of millions, including student records and health data.
- The PowerSchool breach potentially impacted over 62 million students and 9.5 million teachers in the U.S.
- Elon Musk's DOGE access led to a significant compromise of U.S. federal government data, triggering lawsuits to block further access.
- A hacker accessed sensitive data from over a million patients at Community Health Center in Connecticut.
- Stalkerware apps Cocospy, Spyic, and Spyzie exposed personal data of millions due to a security vulnerability.
- DISA confirmed a data breach affecting over 3 million people due to unauthorized access for more than two months.

items.title: Last week to apply to speak at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
items.summary:
- Deadline to apply to speak at TechCrunch Sessions: AI is March 7, 2025, at 11:59 p.m. PT.
- The event will take place on June 5, 2025, at Zellerbach Hall, UC Berkeley.
- Participants can lead dynamic sessions with groups of speakers and engage with topics on AI.
- Key speaking perks include visibility, access to exclusive sessions, and promotional support from TechCrunch.

items.title: Apply to Speak at TechCrunch All Stage 2025
items.summary:
- Founders, VCs, and startup experts are invited to share scaling insights at [TechCrunch All Stage 2025](https://techcrunch.com/events/techcrunch-all-stage-2025/?utm_source=tc&utm_medium=post&utm_campaign=tcallstage2025&utm_content=post_callforcontent_02282025&promo=post_callforcontent_02282025&display=) on July 15 in Boston.
- Opportunities to lead breakout sessions and roundtable discussions are available for those interested.
- Speaker applications close on April 18, 2025; the event focuses on essential scaling topics for startups and networking with industry leaders.

items.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: Final 24 hours to save up to $1,130
items.summary:
- Last chance to save up to $1,130 for passes to [TechCrunch Disrupt 2025](https://techcrunch.com/events/tc-disrupt-2025/?utm_source=tc&utm_medium=post&utm_campaign=disrupt2025&utm_content=post_seb1day_02282025&utm_display=) ends February 28 at 11:59 p.m. PT.
- Event takes place from October 27-29 at Moscone West in San Francisco, celebrating two decades of innovation.
- More than 10,000 tech leaders and over 250 sessions will be featured, including the [Startup Battlefield 200](https://techcrunch.com/events/tc-disrupt-2025/startup-battlefield/?promo=post_seb1day_02282025&utm_campaign=disrupt2025&utm_content=post_seb1day_02282025&utm_medium=post&utm_source=tc) competition.

items.title: Only 3 more days to save up to $325 at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
items.summary:
- Only three days left to save up to $325 on tickets for [TechCrunch Sessions: AI](https://techcrunch.com/events/tc-sessions-ai/?utm_source=tc&utm_medium=post&utm_campaign=tcsessionsai&utm_content=post_seb3days_02282025&promo=post_seb3days_02282025&display=).
- The deadline to secure discounted rates is March 2 at 11:59 p.m. PT.
- The event will take place on June 5 at Zellerbach Hall, UC Berkeley, featuring industry leaders and experts in AI.

items.title: Intel delays its Ohio chip factory to 2030
items.summary:
- Intel's first chip fabrication plant in Ohio may not open until 2030 at the earliest.
- The $28 billion semiconductor project has been delayed for the second time this year due to financial issues.
- Construction completion is now projected for 2030, with potential operations starting in 2031.
- Intel has already invested $3.7 billion locally and remains committed to the project despite the delays.

items.title: Microsoft hangs up on Skype: service to shut down May 5, 2025
items.summary:
- Microsoft will shut down Skype on May 5, 2025, to focus on Teams.
- Skype had over 36 million users in early 2023, down from a peak of 300 million.
- Users can migrate contacts to Teams or export their data before the shutdown, but Skype will cease operations after the deadline.
